meanings.definition: To make up for a deficiency
meanings.sent1: She wanted to redeem her mistake by apologizing sincerely.
meanings.sent2: He tried to redeem his low score by studying harder for the next test.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy waiter tried to redeem himself by offering a free dessert.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness towards others helped redeem her previous selfish actions.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected help from a stranger was enough to redeem the situation.

meanings.definition: To recover ownership of by paying a specified sum
meanings.sent1: He had to redeem his bike from the pawn shop by paying the fee.
meanings.sent2: She was able to redeem her necklace by paying the ransom.
meanings.sent3: The lost dog's owner had to redeem him from the shelter.
meanings.sent4: The antique vase was redeemed by its original owner at the auction.
meanings.sent5: The family redeemed their car by settling the outstanding loan.

meanings.definition: To fulfill a promise or obligation
meanings.sent1: She promised to redeem her debt by the end of the month.
meanings.sent2: He always makes sure to redeem his commitments on time.
meanings.sent3: The knight had to redeem his vow to protect the kingdom.
meanings.sent4: The student redeemed his pledge to help his classmates with their project.
meanings.sent5: The company redeemed its promise to deliver the product before the deadline.

meanings.sent1: She decided to redeem her gift card for cash at the store.
meanings.sent2: He redeemed his savings bonds to have money for the trip.
meanings.sent3: The traveler redeemed his foreign currency at the airport.
meanings.sent4: The player redeemed his casino chips for cash winnings.
meanings.sent5: The merchant redeemed the coupons for cash value at the register.
